column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of Y3GaO6 and 2% Ca2+-, Sr2+-, and Ba2+-doped-Y3GaO6 were prepared via the solid-state reaction route.

#Text=The Y2O3 (Otto, 99.99%), CaCO3 (Alfa Aesar, 99.5%), SrCO3 (Loba Chemie, 99.9%), BaCO3 (Alfa Aesar, 99.9%), and Ga2O3 (Alfa Aesar, 99.99%) were preheated at 300 °C for 5 h and weighed in a stoichiometric amount.
#Text=The raw powders were then mixed in a mortar thoroughly using acetone as a mixing media.
#Text=After grinding, the powder was calcined at 900 °C for 12 h in air.
#Text=Then, the calcined powders were mixed with 2% poly(vinyl alcohol) and uniaxially pressed into pellets by applying a load of ∼6 × 10−5 MPa.
#Text=The samples were then sintered at 1200 °C for 24 h and at 1350 °C for 6 h in air
